Automagically Generated Web Applications

March 2009

In the near future software development will be an one-man-show instead of meetings with project leaders, product managers and architects talking endlessly about requirement specifications and disappearing when the bugs are delivered.

Using Domain Specification Languages and application generators in a near future complete applications can be generated immediately based on business requirements.

DSLs

Domanin Specific Languages (DSL) are very high level abstractions.
Using human language they can describe / make understandable the reality to computers. They can map specific real-world domains to an abstract programming language. And they are converting natural language concepts into programming language specifications.

Or they can compile domain specific knowledge into a set of best practices, design patterns or even into functional components reusable when building another solutions for that domain.

Code That Writes Code

One basic modern principle in software development is DRY: Don't Repeat Yourself.
All repetitive tasks of the development process are extracted into standalone modules and reused when necessary. This makes code more understandable and maintanable.

On this principle are the application generators built. They incorporate best practices about a niche domain, like e-commerce or content publishing.

Once run they generate a skeleton application ready to accept custom business logic and user interface.

Finally

Don't be surprised when you order your next web app and a lonely guy shows up. He will put your requirements into a DSL ans generate a skeleton application you can walk through to discuss the user interface and experience.

This essay is about technology. With focus on speed, domain specific languages, application generators, software development.
Small Shops Win
Programming Languages And The Digital Universe
